data.title: Newcastle University
data.text:
Introduction

As a Business Development Manager in the Faculty of Science, Agriculture and Engineering my role is to support academic and research staff in the development of non-traditional funding sources, intellectual property, commercialisation of IP, spin out company formation. licensing and the development of impact case studies.

Specifically I work with the School of Computing and the School of Mathematics, Statistics and Physics.

I provide:

advice on business development strategy and implementation

assistance with development of non-traditional funding applications and bids

support in identifying key company contacts and approaches

contract development including set up, legal requirements and authorisation

commercial disclosure agreements

intellectual property services including patent searches and filing, IP assessments and market reviews

costing, pricing and compliance

Background

I have a BA (Hons) in Human Geography, specialising in regional economic development and postgrad diploma qualifications from the Chartered Institute of Marketing. I also have formal training in business development, management of intellectual property, commercialisation of intellectual property and advanced licensing. I have completed the PRINCE2 foundation qualification in project management. I am a Registered Technology Transfer Professional (RTTP) candidate.

I have a wealth of experience developed over more than twenty years in both the private sector and HE in the UK and overseas. I have worked as a researcher and in commercial roles for the Universities of Salford, Manchester (UMIST), Sunderland and the University of Pulogadung in Jakarta as well as a number of positions in industry and the third sector working in manufacturing and civil engineering companies. My experience extends across disciplines in science and engineering together with 4 years working closely with schools and institutes in the Faculty of Medical Sciences and the Joint Research Office during my time at Newcastle.

Finally, I am currently a Director and Trustee of Education and Services for People with Autism (ESPA) a top 100 UK charity providing specialist care and services for young people with Autism with two external companies ESPA Research (Analutos) and Autism Works -a software testing company.

Roles and Responsibilities

Commercialisation of Intellectual Property; Licensing; Intellectual Property management; Contracts; Contract and commercially funded research; Technology based company spin-out; Company formation; Consultancy; Continuing Professional Development; Training; Business Development.

Qualifications

BA (Hons) Human Geography

Chartered Institute of Marketing DiP M (3 disciplines)

PRINCE 2 Foundation Certificate in Project management

Registered Technology Transfer Professional (RTTP) Candidate
